You can put a shub:// uri, and if the shub uri is a local Singularity Registry Server (that has an API endpoint) then yes you can. The global client (sregistry-cli) doesn't have a local server so you would not there, for that you would put a localimage to the path to the image (that you retrieve with sregistry get
I was not talking about the pull. I know you can pull from a sregistry. I meant in the recipe header, in the bootstrap/from fields. Can you put a local sregistry with these two fields ?
it has a plugin setup so if something extra is needed (that not everyone wants) we make a plugin!

Singularity Registry Server is docker images. With `docker-compose up -d` you have an entire registry running on localhost. That means a database with images that you push and pull. You can use them locally with shub or sregistry client. You build how you like, from recipes on your computer. I would stronly advise you consider the infrastructure that I've spent years developing before making another one lol
well, not exactly the same, but the image pull has similar structure :wink:
it serves the same api as singularity hub
you technically could if you just use the shub:// uri and give your local registry address

Maybe you can do a mix with shub and a local git repository to add local stuffs. That's what we are doing here. Generic recipes -> shub. Then a local git repository, eg: "local_srecipes" where you build your recipe with a shub bootstrap. These local recipes are almost the same than those on the shub except that I am adding local specific commands (eg: adding my scratch dir or rebuilding an app with the right flags) in the recipe and these recipes are renamed with `.local`. But, indeed, I think it would be useful to be able to Bootstrap directly from a local sregistry.
So we're setting up an internal registry via <https://github.com/singularityhub/sregistry>

Roll my own what exactly? We have an internal singularity registry we're setting up.
<https://singularityhub.github.io/sregistry/>
you should look at Singularity Registry, and roll your own
you would have to wget the image or similar in %setup and save to tmp, although if the existence is checked before that step, that wouldn't work
